measured_by: Pathogen Disgust subscale of the Three Domain Disgust Scale
justification: “we used the pathogen disgust subscale of the Three Domain Disgust Scale (Tybur, Lieberman, & Griskevicius, 2009) to measure disgust sensitivity”
“Disgust sensitivity was measured with the 27-item Disgust Sensitivity Scale-revised (Haidt et al., 1994; modified by Olatunji et al., 2007)”
“Time to first fixation… informs us about the detection speed… The vigilance hypothesis… would predict… a shorter time to first fixation”
“Average visit duration… gives us an indication of participants’ viewing behaviours after detection… which is relevant to both the avoidance and maintenance hypotheses”
“Visit count… will help us distinguish between the vigilance and avoidance hypotheses… the avoidance hypothesis predicts a lower visit count for disgust sensitive individuals”
